label: 足軽
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: In the Taiheiki, conscripted peasant footsodiers or dismounted bushi (I.e.,footsoldiers). In the medieval period, not a term of status but a mode of fighting. Ashigaru of the Tokugawa period were the lowest level of samurai status.　[太平記、武士]
